name: Lucas

projects.title: Classification and Generation of reviews
projects.description: Developed an NLP pipeline for predicting and generating TripAdvisor hotel reviews using classification and text generation models.

projects.title: Short Video Recommender System
projects.description: Developed a content-based video recommendation system using the KuaiRec dataset, achieving 85% precision by leveraging user interactions and video metadata.

projects.title: YoutubeGPT
projects.description: A Python tool that generates concise audio summaries of YouTube videos in any language using ChatGPT and YouTube APIs. It takes a YouTube link and language preference as inputs, processes the video transcript, and outputs a summarized MP3 file.

projects.title: Ask your videos
projects.description: Simple RAG project that allows users to query youtube videos and get answers based on their transcripts.

projects.title: Sudoku OCR
projects.description: An OCR tool for solving Sudoku puzzles using image processing techniques. Implemented from scratch in C without any external libraries.

aboutpara: Passionate EPITA student, curious, devoted, and pedagogical. I love sharing, traveling, skiing, watchmaking, and new technologies. My home lab allows me to have my own server to host services and do recreational deployments.

resume.tagline: ðŸ“š I'm still a student for now.
resume.description: I have a keen interest in artificial intelligence and machine learning. I have a strong foundation in programming languages such as Python, Java, C... I have worked on several projects related to AI and ML, including image classification and natural language processing. I am always eager to learn new technologies and improve my skills.

experiences.position: Teaching Assistant (YAKA) at EPITA: Ecole d'IngÃ©nieurs en Informatique
bullets: Worked as part of a team of over 50 teaching assistants and received multiple training sessions on pedagogy and oral expression to enhance teaching skills.
Followed up on my previous experience as a teaching assistant by supporting second-semester third year students alongside my studies (approximately 50 hours per month).
Supervised various workshops, including an intensive programming week (9 AM to midnight) covering Java, JavaScript, and C++.
Also bigger projects such as one-week project to create a backend in Java using Quarkus, ORM, and Kafka, or the Tiger project, to develop a compiler in C++.
Traveled to other campuses to provide in-person assistance to students, supporting a total of 600 students.
Implemented a data straightening using RAG.
Fullstack web application: search in knowledge base with RAG & annotation/validation.
Explored ways to value unstructured textual data.
Supervised by Philippe Vialletelle

experiences.position: Teaching Assistant C# and OCaml at EPITA: Ecole d'IngÃ©nieurs en Informatique
bullets: Supervision of practical works in C# and OCaml for first-year EPITA students
Designed a practical and implemented a test-suite for grading deployed for over 600 students
Updated and automated server installation procedures using Debian Preseed, Ansible and shell scripts
Developed a prototype computer vision software in Python using OpenCV and Tkinter for interface.
Authored technical documentation
Prepared engines for Volvo mini excavators
Order preparation

education.universityPara: Grade: 3.7. AI & Data Science major. Member of communication team and student event. Enjoy engaging with peers and promoting our school's events and values. Eager to gain hands-on experience and contribute to the success of our school community. Completed a 6-month exchange semester at San Francisco State University (SFSU).
